Package imusim :: Package io :: Module vicon_csv

Source Code for Module imusim.io.vicon_csv

 1  """ 
 2  Loader for Vicon optical capture data in CSV format. 
 3  """ 
 4   
 5  from __future__ import division 
 6  from imusim.capture.marker import MarkerCapture, Marker3DOF 
 7  import numpy as np 
 8   

 9 -def loadViconCSVFile(filename): 

10      """ 
11      Load 3DOF marker data from a Vicon CSV file. 
12   
13      @param filename: Name of the CSV file to load. 
14   
15      @return: A L{MarkerCapture} object. 
16      """ 
17      # Open file to read header. 
18      datafile = open(filename, 'r') 
19   
20      # Function to get comma-separated values from a line. 
21      values = lambda line: line.rstrip('\r\n').split(',') 
22   
23      # Get column names. 
24      colnames = values(datafile.readline()) 
25   
26      # Get marker names. 
27      markernames = [n.split(':')[-2] for n in colnames[2::3]] 
28   
29      # Get data. 
30      data = np.array([[float(v or np.nan) for v in values(line)] 
31          for line in datafile.readlines()]).T 
32   
33      frameTimes = data[1] 
34      positions = data[2:].reshape((len(markernames),3,-1)) / 1000 
35   
36      capture = MarkerCapture() 
37      capture.frameTimes = frameTimes 
38      capture.frameCount = len(frameTimes) 
39      capture.framePeriod = np.min(np.diff(frameTimes)) 
40      capture.frameRate = 1 / capture.framePeriod 
41   
42      for i, name in enumerate(markernames): 
43          marker = Marker3DOF(capture, name) 
44          for time, position in zip(capture.frameTimes, positions[i].T): 
45              marker.positionKeyFrames.add(time, position.reshape(3,1)) 
46   
47      return capture
